intro: Wissadula periplocifolia var. guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan spurge, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, thick leaves and striking yellow-orange cyathia. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its adaptability and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in arid and semi-arid regions.
